JobFullDesc: The Manager of New Product Introduction for Materials will lead a team responsible for overseeing the readiness, execution, and delivery of New Product Introduction xVT builds for all Compute, Networking, and Storage equipment required at Facebook Data Centers. The role will be responsible for driving key cross functional partnerships to develop and execute sourcing strategies, organizational efficiency, scale, and growth.Lead and develop a team of New Product Introduction Materials Managers.Analyze the overall supply chain to identify risk and drive resolution to systemic issues affecting quality, cost, delivery, and lead-times.Lead SOW/Design Agreement negotiation process with internal partners and ODM/OEM suppliers.Own market cost, actual unit, and data which feeds into total cost of ownership (“TCO”) models. Ensure project costs meet objectives.Execute solutions to eliminate shortages impacting build and ship schedules.Execute NPI sourcing phase gate, to include EVT/DVT/PVT/Pilot/Release-to-Production activities.Partner across stakeholders and NPI team on roadmap alignment, including strategic and tactical procurement activities worldwide.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS8+ years of Sourcing or Supply Chain Management experience in commercial or technical sourcing roles.Experience working in Asia-based EMS/ODM/JDM/OEM business models, and knowledge of consignment and turnkey materials management, commercial agreement negotiation, cost modeling, supply chain design, and reverse logistics.Experience and knowledge with hardware design.Demonstrated experience improving supply chain and supplier performance, to include the use of cost models and objective based performance measures.Demonstrated experience driving a plan to bring resolution to differing opinions, reaching out across functional boundaries to drive collaboration, and sharing credit in a team environment.Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together.
